metadata.Title: CVE-2015-4816 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Unspecified vulnerability in Oracle MySQL Server 5.5.44 and earlier allows remote authenticated users to affect availability via unknown vectors related to Server : InnoDB.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-4816` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

mariadb-client - 10.0.22-0ubuntu1
mariadb-client-10.0 - 10.0.22-0ubuntu1
mariadb-client-core-10.0 - 10.0.22-0ubuntu1
mariadb-common - 10.0.22-0ubuntu1
mariadb-connect-engine-10.0 - 10.0.22-0ubuntu1
mariadb-oqgraph-engine-10.0 - 10.0.22-0ubuntu1
mariadb-server - 10.0.22-0ubuntu1
mariadb-server-10.0 - 10.0.22-0ubuntu1
mariadb-server-core-10.0 - 10.0.22-0ubuntu1
mariadb-test - 10.0.22-0ubuntu1
mariadb-test-10.0 - 10.0.22-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mariadb-10.0 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '10.0.22-0ubuntu1').
percona-server-5.6: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
percona-xtradb-cluster-5.6: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
